channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report X-2023060972
item.description:
Report X-2023060972

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-07
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET REG. BOX WAS FOUND WHILE UNLOADING A TRUCK, THEN PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE AND BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGE HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: NARROW SIDE OF ONE OF THE BOTTLES HAS A PUNCTURE HOLE IN IT CAUSING IT TO LEAK. REASON UNKNOWN, THERE ARE NO HOLES IN THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: TURNED THE BOX RIGHT SIDE UP ACCORDING TO THE DIRECTIONAL ARROWS PRINTED ON THE BOX.

item.title: Report E-2023060363
item.description:
Report E-2023060363

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 2.5ft-by-2.5ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that thirty (30) pounds of material was released due to a load shift during transit damaging one (1) poly pail causing the lid to come off. First Call Environmental personnel moved all the poly pails from the pallet to verify only one (1) pail was damaged and then swept up the released material. The non-damaged pails were restacked on to two pallets and shipped onto the consignee. The damaged poly pail was placed into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum along with the recovered released material and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilizing. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking. Was brought by package handler tugger. QA placed package in leaker tote to prevent further damage. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA placed package in leaker tote to prevent further damage.

item.title: Report X-2023060560
item.description:
Report X-2023060560

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-01
  • City: GAYLORD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023060560 SequenceEvent: Package handler found package leaking and called to qa for inspection from trailer# 830244 around 6:30 am. Called to QA. QA retrieved package and inspected. Upon inspection, QA determined it was damages and the package was placed in Hazardous materials bin and placed outside due to ventilation. DescribePack: There were loose caps that leads to leakage of the hazardous materials DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: QA determined it was damages and the package was placed in Hazardous materials bin and placed outside due to ventilation. 2. X-2023060567 SequenceEvent: Package handler found the leaking package and called for QA to inspect package coming from trailer 830244 around 6:37. Upon inspection the package was determined to be leaking and hazardous. Package was then put into a Hazardous material bin and carried outside by 2 package handlers. DescribePack: Loose caps were the cause of the leaking containers DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: QA was notified of a hazardous leaking package. The package was then immediately put into a tote and put outside for ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023060869
item.description:
Report X-2023060869

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-24
  • City: CADILLAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found around 10:30 am (according to the 15 scan time) The package was put inside a HAZMAT bag and in a black tote. I was asked to process it after I arrived at work at 3pm. I started processing it at 3:45pm. I put on my heavy rubber gloves and mask and started processing it. DescribePack: Upon opening package 2 out of 3 gallon jugs caps were loose and the inner seals were punctured. The inside of the box was wet and a little on the outside. When I first looked at the items all 3 jugs appeared to have the same amount of liquid. At first I thought the damage came from outside source. I removed the caps and 2 out of 3 bottles seals were punctured. About 1 ounce out of each jug leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon being discovered the package was immediately put into a hazmat bag and black tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060864
item.description:
Report X-2023060864

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: CADILLAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the quality assurance area. I do not know where it came from or how it got there. DescribePack: The package shows there was leakage on the top of the box according to the directional arrows. When the contents were examined, the plastic bottle was contained in a plastic bag. This bag held all the loose spillage from the bottle. If the bottle is turned on its side, the liquid flows freely from beneath the cap. The plastic bag was not opened to examine why the leakage occurred because off all the liquid in it. The cap does not appear to be loose. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Release was contained to the package only.

item.title: Report X-2023060592
item.description:
Report X-2023060592

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-18
  • City: CADILLAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on unload trailer during IB Sort on its side on top of other packages leaking. The item leaked on 4 other packages that had to be Re-packed. The package was placed inside hazmat bag and tote immediately on being discovered. DescribePack: Upon me processing the damage package I found the bottle was leaking through the cap due to the inner seal being opened. Not sure if the pressure from a laying on its side or was punctured when the plastic cap was put on. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a Hazmat bag and tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060295
item.description:
Report X-2023060295

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: PORTAGE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was moving package from one trailer to another when they dropped the package, causing small amount of powder to spill out. Package was removed from area, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE. Chemical neutralizer was added to powder, and powder was cleaned up. Upon inspection, it was discovered that lid of jug came slightly loose, which caused the powder spill. DescribePack: No visible damage DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from area, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE. Chemical neutralizer was added to powder, and powder was cleaned up.

  • Description: 1. X-2023060250 SequenceEvent: Delivery refused by customer due to box corrosion + strong chemical odor. Upon driver's return, package was removed from vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE, where it was discovered that undeclared HazMat leaked into box. DescribePack: Loose cap, causing ~3tbsp to spill out into box DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE. 2. X-2023060251 SequenceEvent: Delivery refused by customer due to box corrosion + strong chemical odor. Upon driver's return, package was removed from vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE, where it was discovered that undeclared HazMat leaked into box. DescribePack: Loose cap, causing ~1tbsp liquid to spill into box DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from vehicle, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE

  • Description: SequenceEvent: SMELLY BOX W/ CORROSIVE DIMOND WAS FOUND AND PUT IN A HAZMAT BOX AND LEFT FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO HAVE A LOOSE CAP ALLOWING PRODUCT TO LEAK, ONLY A COUPLE OF OUNCES HAD LEAKED OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: CAP WAS TIGHTENED.

item.title: Report X-2023050801
item.description:
Report X-2023050801

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-13
  • City: CADILLAC
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the package on the Re-Pack table in a plastic bag in a tote. I was asked to process when I came in. I found the package wet. DescribePack: Upon opening the package 2-1gallon jugs could be seen along with a wet inner package. Upon opening the inner package there were 2-1 gallon jugs.1 of those jugs had a loose cap with about 8ounces missing. All 4 bottles were wet along with the inner and outer packaging. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was put into a plastic bag and a plastic tote. That is how I found it when I came in at 12pm. Started processing it as soon as I could which was about 12:15. The Package should have been put in a HAZMAT bag and tote but was not. I used rubber gloves and 2 disposable masks the fumes were overwhelming.

DescribePack: Loose cap, approximately 2tbsp liquid spilled. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from trailer, placed in a HazMat tote, and taken to HazMat cage using proper PPE.
